course_title: Introduction to Business Processes and Operations

101.comments: Restricted to non-Commerce students only. If you have been admitted by your Faculty to the Minor in Commerce or you are in another approved program for which this course is a requirement, and you are unable to register in any section of this course in your final year of study, you may submit a registration request using the form available at mybcom.sauder.ubc.ca/regi-assist. Commerce course registration is managed centrally by the UBC Sauder Undergraduate Office. Change of Registration (Add/Drop) forms signed by instructors will not be accepted.

201.comments: This section will be offered in a flexible learning format. Rather than attending traditional in-class lectures for three hours each week, students in a flexible format section will spend more time with online learning materials in preparation for fewer scheduled in-person meeting times. Instructors will provide exact dates for in-person meeting times closer to the start of term.Restricted to non-Commerce students only. description: The design and management of systems that efficiently and effectively supply products and services to the end-user. The concepts apply to a variety of settings such as manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, and others (For non-Commerce students only). Not for students with credit for, or exemption from, COMM 204.
